00013 /**********************************************************************
00014  * hookapi.h
00015  * Author: Heng Yin <hyin@ece.cmu.edu>
00016  *
00017  * This file is responsible for registering and calling function hooks.
00018  * 
00019  */ 
00020 ////////////////////////////////////
00021 /// @defgroup hookapi hookapi: Function Hooking Facility
00022 ///
00023 
00024 #ifndef HOOKAPI_H_INCLUDED
00025 #define HOOKAPI_H_INCLUDED
00026 
00027 typedef int (*hook_proc_t)(void *opaque);
00028 
00029 void init_hookapi();
00030 void hookapi_cleanup();
00031 
00032 /// @ingroup hookapi
00033 /// install a hook at the function entry
00034 /// @param is_global flag specifies if this hook should be invoked globally or only in certain execution context
00035 /// @param eip address of function to be hooked (has to be the start of a basic block
00036 /// @param fnhook address of function hook
00037 /// @param opaque address of an opaque structure provided by caller (has to be globally allocated)
00038 //  @param sizeof_opaque size of the opaque structure (if opaque is an integer, not a pointer to a structure, sizeof_opaque must be zero) 
00039 /// @return a handle that uniquely specifies this hook 
00040 uintptr_t
00041 hookapi_hook_function(
00042                int is_global,
00043                uint32_t eip, 
00044                hook_proc_t fnhook, 
00045                void *opaque, 
00046                uint32_t sizeof_opaque
00047                );
00048 
00049 /// @ingroup hookapi
00050 /// install a hook at the function exit
00051 /// @param eip function return address 
00052 /// @param fnhook address of function hook
00053 /// @param opaque address of an opaque structure provided by caller (has to be globally allocated)
00054 //  @param sizeof_opaque size of the opaque structure (if opaque is an integer, not a pointer to a structure, sizeof_opaque must be zero) 
00055 /// @return a handle that uniquely specifies this hook 
00056 /// The implementation of this function handles multi-threading. It means, when
00057 /// multple threads call the same function and register the same return address, 
00058 /// we can distinguish different hooks, and invoke them correctly.
00059 uintptr_t 
00060 hookapi_hook_return(
00061                uint32_t eip, 
00062                hook_proc_t fnhook, 
00063                void *opaque, 
00064                uint32_t sizeof_opaque
00065                );
00066 
00067 /// @ingroup hookapi
00068 /// remove a hook
00069 /// @param handle hook handle returned by hookapi_hook_function or hookapi_hook_return  
00070 /// This function will not free the opaque structure provided by the caller 
00071 /// when installing a hook. The caller is responsible for freeing it.
00072 /// The exception is when the user's plugin is unloaded, the opaque structure is
00073 /// freed automatically to avoid memory leakage. Likewise, when a vm state 
00074 /// (i.e. snapshot) is loaded, the opaque structure is allocated and 
00075 /// restored automatically.  
00076 void hookapi_remove_hook(uintptr_t handle);
00077 
00078 
00079 /// @ingroup hookapi
00080 /// install a hook at the function entry by specifying module name and function name
00081 /// @param mod module name that this function is located in
00082 /// @param func function name
00083 /// @param  flag specifies if this hook should be invoked globally or only in certain execution context
00084 /// @param eip address of function to be hooked (has to be the start of a basic block
00085 /// @param fnhook address of function hook
00086 /// @param opaque address of an opaque structure provided by caller (has to be globally allocated)
00087 //  @param sizeof_opaque size of the opaque structure (if opaque is an integer, not a pointer to a structure, sizeof_opaque must be zero) 
00088 void hookapi_hook_function_byname(const char *mod, const char *func, 
00089   int is_global, hook_proc_t fnhook, void *opaque, uint32_t sizeof_opaque);
00090 
00091 
00092 /// @ingroup hookapi
00093 /// search and invoke the corresponding hooks at the current eip
00094 /// @param in_context flag that specifies if the current execution is in the analysis context
00095 /// This function is usually called in plugin's block_begin callback, to check 
00096 /// and invoke hooks. This function deals with the situation that multiple hooks 
00097 /// are installed on the same function entry or exit. It is able to distinguish 
00098 /// different hooks and invoke them correctly.
00099 void hookapi_check_call(int in_context);
00100 
00101 #endif
